reference.title: Marking a term for a dictionary

section.indexterm: terminology listsmarking terms for adding to dictionary
section.p:
You can mark new terms and found terms to add them to a dictionary. You do this by clicking Mark for dictionaryâ€¦ in one of the following windows:
Work with New Terms List
Work with Found Terms List
The Mark Term for Dictionary window is displayed (see ). windowsMark Term for Dictionary Mark Term for Dictionary windowFigure shows Mark Term for Dictionary window

section.title: Options and parameters

plentry.pd: The current term from the terminology list is displayed.
Optionally, type the translation for the term to be copied to the dictionary.

plentry.pt: Add context information to dictionary entry
plentry.pd: If you have created the terminology list with context information, this information is copied to this field. You can also type your own context information. To save the context information to the dictionary, mark the check box.
The list box contains all available dictionaries that are not protected. Select the dictionary where you want the term to be added.

section.p: To save the processing information for this term, click Mark.
To skip the current term, select the Skip button.
If several terms are marked for the dictionary, the next term is displayed in the Term field. If all marked terms were displayed, you are returned to the previous window.

section.title: Results
section.p: The selected term is prepared for addition to a dictionary. When all terms marked for the dictionary are processed, you can add more information, depending on the structure of the selected dictionary in the Edit Entry in Dictionary window.
